verses.roman:
bhagavad-darśanāhlāda-
bāṣpa-paryākulekṣaṇaḥ
pulakacitāṅga autkaṇṭhyāt
svākhyāne nāśakan nṛpa

synonyms: bhagavat—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; darśana—because of seeing; āhlāda—due to the joy; bāṣpa—with tears; paryākula—overflowing; īkṣaṇaḥ—whose eyes; pulaka—with eruptions; ācita—marked; autkaṇṭhyāt—from eagerness; sva-ākhyāne—to announce himself; na aśakat—he was not able; nṛpa—O King.
translation: The joy of seeing the Supreme Lord flooded Akrūra's eyes with tears and decorated his limbs with eruptions of ecstasy. He felt such eagerness that he could not speak to present himself, O King.
